intro: Phyllanthus garipensis, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade. Phyllanthus garipensis is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various ailments.
